00006 #ifndef SFLASH_H

00012 typedef uint16_t sflash_pattern_t;
00013 
00014 
00015 /* This structure is defined here so the compiler can allocate enough
00016    memory for it.  However, its fields should be treated as
00017    private.  */
00018 typedef struct
00019 {
00020     sflash_pattern_t pattern;
00021     sflash_pattern_t current;
00022 } sflash_obj_t;
00023 
00024 
00025 typedef sflash_obj_t *sflash_t;
00026 
00027 
00028 /* These routines are for sequencing the flashing of a LED or beeping
00029    a piezo tweeter.  Each pattern is 16 bits in length.  The current
00030    LSB of a pattern determines whether the LED should be lit.  The
00031    pattern is then shifted to the right.  When it is zero, it is
00032    reloaded.  Thus the patterns are repeating and the length of the
00033    sequence can be fewer than 16 bits.
00034 
00035    For example,
00036      0bxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx1 will keep a LED on
00037      0b0000000000000010 will toggle the LED every period
00038      0b0000000000001100 will toggle the LED every second period
00039      0b0000000011110000 will toggle the LED every fourth period
00040      0b1111111100000000 will toggle the LED every eighth period
00041      0x1010101010000000 will flash the LED 5 times out of 16 periods
00042  */
00043 
00044 
00045 /* Set the flash pattern and the initial sequence.  If you don't care
00046    about the phasing use 0 or pattern for initial.  */
00047 static inline void
00048 sflash_pattern_set (sflash_t sflash, sflash_pattern_t pattern,
00049                     sflash_pattern_t initial)
00050 {
00051     sflash->pattern = pattern;
00052     sflash->current = initial;
00053 }
00054 
00055 
00056 static inline sflash_pattern_t
00057 sflash_pattern_get (sflash_t sflash)
00058 {
00059     return sflash->pattern;
00060 }
00061 
00062 extern bool
00063 sflash_update (sflash_t);
00064 
00065 #endif
